subscribe

public void subscribe(int type,
                      int interval)
               throws RbxGhostException
Enables streaming camera data. This method must be called before any vision data will be available.

Two types of streaming data are available:

  • SUBSCRIBE_COGNITS - vision/recognition data
  • SUBSCRIBE_SOURCE - original source image The interval is in 200ms units. Streaming rates are not guaranteed. Set interval to 1 in order to obtain the fastest possible streaming rate (5 Hz). A larger interval will usually help reduce CPU usage.

    This method may be called more than once in order to subscribe to different types of data or to change the data rate for a particular type of data.

    Parameters:
    type - the subscription type (SUBSCRIBE_COGNITS or SUBSCRIBE_SOURCE)
    interval - the subscription interval, in 200ms increments
    Throws:
    RbxGhostException - if the Cam has become a ghost

    • unsubscribe

    public void unsubscribe(int type)
    Disables streaming camera data for the specified subscription type.

    Parameters:
    type - the subscription type (SUBSCRIBE_COGNITS or SUBSCRIBE_SOURCE)

    isSubscribed

    public boolean isSubscribed(int type)
    Determines if this Cam is currently subscribed to the specified data type.

    Parameters:
    type - the subscription type (SUBSCRIBE_COGNITS or SUBSCRIBE_SOURCE)

    getCognitionParams

    public CognitionParams getCognitionParams()
    Returns a copy of the camera's set of cognition parameters. The returned object contains the parameters which were used to produce the the camera's most recent list of Cognits.

    Returns:
    the camera's cognition parameters
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Cam is not currently subscribed to Cognits data
    Since:
    1.1.0
    See Also:
    getCognits()

    setCognitionParams

    public void setCognitionParams(CognitionParams cogParams)
                        throws RbxGhostException
    Sets the camera's set of cognition parameters. Note that the effects of this method are not immediate. The new cognition params are sent to the Nexus and are applied the next time cognition is performed.

    Parameters:
    cogParams - the new cognition parameters to set
    Throws:
    RbxGhostException - if the Cam has become a ghost
    Since:
    1.1.0

    getCognitionParamsMod

    public int getCognitionParamsMod()
    This convenience method returns the modifcation number for the camera's CognitionParams. This method is provided to reduce object creation when testing for new cognition parameters. This method is the same as calling getCognitionParams().getMod(), except that this method does not create a new CognitionParams object.

    Returns:
    the mod for the camera's cognition params
    Since:
    1.1.0

    getCognits

    public Cognit[] getCognits()
    Returns an array of Cognits (recognized objects) which are found in the camera's most recent image.

    Returns:
    array of cognits
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Cam is not currently subscribed to Cognits data
    See Also:
    subscribe(int, int)

    getSegmentedImageData

    public int[] getSegmentedImageData(int[] imgBuf)
    Obtains the RGB data for the camera's most recent segmented image.

    A segmented image is part of a Cam's cognit data. A segmented image contains all Cognits which are found in the camera's most recent image. Individual Cognit images are color-coded according to on their 'fit' error--the smaller the error, the darker the color.

    Each int in the array represents one pixel. The most significant byte is zero. The next byte is the red level, followed by green, and then blue, i.e. 

     |  MSB |     |       |  LSB |
 | 0x00 | red | green | blue |

    This method copies data into the specified int array and returns it. If the specified array is null or is too small to hold the image data, a new array is created, filled, and returned.

    Parameters:
    imgBuf - int array in which to copy the image data; may be null
    Returns:
    the camera's most recent segmented image data
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Cam is not currently subscribed to Cognits data
    See Also:
    subscribe(int, int)

    getCognitsMod

    public int getCognitsMod()
    Returns the camera's cognit modification number. This number is incremented every time the camera receives a segmented image along with a list of cognits.

    This function is typically used to determine if the camera has received new cognit data.

    Returns:
    the camera's cognit mod

    getSourceImageData

    public int[] getSourceImageData(int[] imgBuf)
    Returns the RGB data for the camera's most recent 'source' image.

    A source image is the original image which is passed to the vision system for cognit processing. This is sometimes known as the 'preview' image.

    Each int in the array represents one pixel. The most significant byte is zero. The next byte is the red level, followed by green, and then blue, i.e. 

     |  MSB |     |       |  LSB |
 | 0x00 | red | green | blue |

    This method copies data into the specified int array and returns it. If the specified array is null or is too small to hold the image data, a new array is created, filled, and returned.

    Parameters:
    imgBuf - int array in which to copy the image data; may be null
    Returns:
    the camera's most recent source image data
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Cam is not currently subscribed to Source data
    See Also:
    subscribe(int, int)

    getSourceImageMod

    public int getSourceImageMod()
    Returns the modification number of the camera's 'source' image. This number is incremented every time the camera receives a source image.

    This function is typically used to determine if the camera has received a new source image.

    Returns:
    the camera's source image mod

    getRepName

    public java.lang.String getRepName()
    Returns the name of the peer object (the Rep) to which this Camera is connected.

    Returns:
    the Rep's name

    getRepLocation

    public java.lang.String getRepLocation()
    Returns the location of the Cam's peer. e.g. "127.0.0.1"

    Returns:
    the connection location

    getRepResponseTimeMs

    public int getRepResponseTimeMs()
    Returns the average reponse time (aka ping time) of the Cam's peer. This is the amount of time it takes a message to make a round trip, to the peer and back again.

    Returns:
    the average response time (in milliseconds) of the Cam's peer

    isGhost

    public boolean isGhost()
    Determines if the Cam is a ghost.

    A Cam may become disconnected from its peer object in the Nexus. This could happen, for example, if the device is unplugged, the Nexus is shut down, or the Nexus connection is lost (network problems). In such a case, the Cam dies and becomes a "ghost".

    A ghost Cam has the following properties:

  • It receives no new data from its Nexus-based peer object.
  • getXxx() methods still work, but the data will be stale and will no longer be updated.
  • The Cam object will never come back to life. If the Cam becomes accessible again later, a new Cam object will be created.

    • Returns:
    true if the Cam has become a ghost; false otherwise
